com.cronos.im.logic
Class UserStatusEventListener

java.lang.Object
  com.cronos.im.logic.UserStatusEventListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.topcoder.chat.status.ChatStatusEventListener, java.util.EventListener
public class UserStatusEventListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.topcoder.chat.status.ChatStatusEventListener

This class implements ChatStatusEventListener. It is used to deal with the change event of user status. When the user is changed from OFFLINE to ONLINE, a user message pool is registered for this user. When the user is changed to OFFLINE, the user message pool is un-registered.

This listener can be plugged into "Chat Status Tracker" component to track the change event of user status.

Thread-safety: This class is thread-safe. This class is immutable and the dependencies of this class are also thread-safe.

Version:
1.0
Author:
justforplay, TCSDEVELOPER

Constructor to create UserStatusEventListener with given parameters.

Parameters:
userStatusTracker - ChatUserStatusTracker instance where this event listener belongs to. Can't be null.
messagePool - message pool instance used to register or un-register the message pool. Can't be null.
logger - logger instance used to log the operations. Can be null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the messagePool or userStatusTracker is null.
Method Detail

statusChanged

public void statusChanged(long id,
                          com.topcoder.database.statustracker.Entity entity,
                          com.topcoder.database.statustracker.Status oldStatus,
                          com.topcoder.database.statustracker.Status newStatus)

This method deals with the event of "User Status Changed". When the user is changed from OFFLINE to ONLINE, a user message pool is registered for this user. When the user is changed to OFFLINE, the user message pool is un-registered.

Logging is performed in this method for two main operation "Register Message Pool for User" and "Un-register Messsage Pool for User" at INFO level.

Note: Any exceptions except IllegalArgumentException are ignored, but logging of the error message is still performed.

Specified by:
statusChanged in interface com.topcoder.chat.status.ChatStatusEventListener
Parameters:
id - id of concrete entity, any possible int value
entity - Entity instance, null impossible
oldStatus - old status of entity, Status instance, null is possible
newStatus - new status of entity, Status instance, null impossible;
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if entity or newStatus parameters are null, or entity is not user entity

Gets the message pool used in this listener.

The return value will never be null.

message pool used in this instance

The return value will never be null.

ChatUserStatusTracker where this event listener belongs to.
